titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, Office of Communications, Office of the Director, Office Files of Alice Allen and Lloyd Garrison
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, Office of Communications, Office of the Director, Office Files of Alice Allen and Lloyd Garrison FA635

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-07-01 01:41:15 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, Office of Communications, Office of the Director, Office Files of Alice Allen and Lloyd Garrison

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimal Processing has been conducted to establish basic intellectual and physical control of the material and assess immediate preservation and conservation needs. Material remains as received, in original folders and storage boxes.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

When requesting to view audiovisual material, please refer to the Title and the AV Number (example: AV 1916). Researchers are asked to check the "Restrictions" note for each Title. If a Title does not currently have an access copy, please contact a RAC archivist for further instruction.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Primarily contains correspondence, memoranda, reports, and press logs.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Alice Allen worked as a Senior Advisor in the Ford Foundation's Office of Communications.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Lloyd McKim Garrison (1931-2014) was a journalist who, from 1991 to 1995, served as Director of the Ford Foundation's Office of Communications. Garrison left the Office of Communications to work on the Ford Foundation History Project which was intended to generate an authorized history of the Foundation from 1980 to 1995 (Ford Foundation records, Ford Foundation History Project (FA251).

Garrison's pre-Ford Foundation journalism career encompassed positions in radio, TV, and print media. He was a news writer at NBC News and then he worked at the New York Times where he covered Europe and Africa. Later, he was a staff writer at Time Magazine and started a bimonthly magazine for the United Nations Development Program.

Garrison was a great-great-grandson of William Lloyd Garrison, abolitionist and founder of the anti-slavery newspaper, the Liberator. His father Lloyd K. Garrison was President of the New York City Board of Education from 1961 to 1967, preceding the decentralization of the city's public school system. Lloyd K. Garrison served on the Mayor's Advisory Panel on Decentralization chaired by Ford Foundation President McGeorge Bundy for a week before leaving the Board of Education in 1967 (Ford Foundation records, New York City Decentralization of Schools (FA1524)).
During his retirement, Garrison founded the Norfolk Now newspaper in Norfolk, Connecticut where he lived. Garrison died in 2014.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Ford Foundation has title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.
